content.description: Low angle slab route with 7 bolts to chain anchor
content.location: To the right of Shit Faced.

content.description: See beta photo, follow the bolts up.
content.protection: 6 bolts, a few cams to 1.5".  Anchors.

content.description: Right slanting groove to a bolt and first crux.  Then follow the right slanting crack to another crux about 10ft below the anchor.
content.protection: 1 bolt and gear from small to #1camalot, 2 bolt anchor with chains

content.description:
Mammoth Area Rock Climbs lists this route as an unknown gear route.  It's not clear where the first ascentionists want one to start.  The way we did it, we thought it was around 5.9.  If you started farther right (to the right of what is shown in the beta photo) where the left facing corner comes all the way to the ground, it would be considerably harder.  But that seems an unlikely place to start because the corner takes no gear in a few places where you would definitely want some.

Crux the way we did it was at the second bolt.  Still a bit crunchy and licheny.
content.protection: Cams small to 2", three bolts just where you need them.

content.description: Update - bolts have been pulled.  Original description: First bolted route from the left at the crag. 7 bolts (very closely bolted).
content.protection: gear, 2 bolts; chain anchors shared with next route to the right (Hangover).

content.description: This climb heads up the arête immediately left of the 4:20 wall. Climb up a crack system that curves around the right side of a bulge at the start, continue up and through a roof, pass one protection bolt and continue up to a ledge. 30+ meters, Lower off.
content.protection: Tiny to 2.5 inches. Use long slings to reduce rope drag. 2-bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: Just left of Old Married Couple.

content.description:
TLDR: Mediocre route.  Don't waste your time.  This route will probably never even see enough ascents to quite clean up.  0 out of 3 or 1 out of 5 stars.

This is a mediocre line forced up through dirt, bushes, and ledges, with little worthwhile climbing compared to the rest of the canyon, and the Eastern Sierra canyons overall.  Each pitch is separated by walking on ledges and easy terrain. Unfortunately, you can't see much of that from the ground, or you would probably reconsider climbing the route.

The beta in the book is not good overall.  The effort to descend is not worth the quality of the climbing, in my opinion.  You can use a set of rap anchors for the final rappel to the climber's right of the large first pitch corner.

I edited this description to help with the FA Team's ego.  I was a little more critical the first time around.
content.protection: If you don't want to run it out a bit, bring doubles in the BD larger sizes (not the #5).
content.location:
Far left of 4:20 wall.  Big corner.  Pretty obvious.

A double rope most likely will NOT get you to the ground.  Do a few more shorter rappels.  Just avoid, even better.

content.description: Enjoyable closely bolted slab route with a bulge.  Crux is getting established at the bulge, but the bulge itself is not bad.
content.protection: 9 bolts, shares a chain anchor with Town Drunk.
content.location: To the right of Town Drunk.
